scenario:
Illinois Tool Works (ITW) is a Dividend King with 61 consecutive years of dividend increases, more than tripling its dividend in the last 10 years. The company operates a flexible business model with dozens of brands across seven segments, allowing it to deliver solutions based on customer needs. ITW has invested $800 million in 2024 to support long-term growth and plans to accelerate customer-back innovation (CBI) investments.

ITW has more than doubled its operating margins over the last 15 years by focusing on profitability rather than sales. The company achieved record operating margins of 26.8% in 2024 and expects a 100-basis-point increase in operating margins for 2025. ITW aims to achieve 30% operating margins by 2030, along with 4% annual organic growth, 7% annual dividend growth, 9% to 10% average annual earnings-per-share (EPS) growth, and 100% free cash flow (FCF) conversion.

ITW returned $3.2 billion to shareholders in 2024, with $1.7 billion in dividends and $1.5 billion in stock buybacks, and expects a similar capital return program in 2025. The company has a 24.9 price-to-earnings ratio based on 2025 guidance, which is somewhat pricey. However, ITW's structure and decentralized decision-making allow it to navigate cycles well and react quickly to changes in demand.

ITW's 2024 EPS was $10.15, and the company is guiding to $10.15 to $10.55 in 2025, with a $0.30 per share foreign currency transaction headwind. Excluding certain items, ITW's 2024 EPS was $10.15, so the company is penciling in very little short-term growth. Despite this, ITW is an excellent dividend stock to buy now due to its stable business, growing operating margins, and capital return program backed by free cash flow.
